perturbation.original_text: The Offer shall be open for acceptance from the time of commencement until a time that is not earlier than 3:30 p.m. (Tokyo time) on the 30t h Japan Business Day from and including the Launch Date (as adjusted pursuant to Section 2.02(f) below, the "Offer Period").
perturbation.changed_text: The Offer shall be open for acceptance from the time of commencement until a time that is not earlier than 3:30 p.m. (Tokyo time) on the 10th Japan Business Day from and including the Launch Date (as adjusted pursuant to Section 2.02(f) below, the "Offer Period").
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the offer period to 10 days may conflict with Japanese regulations regarding tender offer periods, which are generally set to ensure shareholders have sufficient time to evaluate the offer, creating non-compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Articles 27-2 through 27-22 of the FIEL (Financial Instruments and Exchange Law of Japan) dictates minimum tender offer periods.

perturbation.original_text: For […***…] ([…***…]) years from and after the date of this Agreement, the Company will hold and treat in confidence, and will not use, and will cause their Affiliates to hold and treat in confidence, all non-public documents and information (including any information with regard to terms and conditions of this Agreement) concerning Acquiror and each of its respective Affiliates, except to the extent that such documents and information (1) are required or requested (with prompt notice of such request to be made to Acquiror) to be disclosed by applicable Law or any Governmental Authority, (2) generally become available to the public through no fault of the Company, (3) become available to the Company on a non-confidential basis, or (4) are independently developed by the Company or its Affiliates without reference to the furnished information.
perturbation.changed_text: For one (1) year from and after the date of this Agreement, the Company will hold and treat in confidence, and will not use, and will cause their Affiliates to hold and treat in confidence, all non-public documents and information (including any information with regard to terms and conditions of this Agreement) concerning Acquiror and each of its respective Affiliates, except to the extent that such documents and information (1) are required or requested (with prompt notice of such request to be made to Acquiror) to be disclosed by applicable Law or any Governmental Authority, (2) generally become available to the public through no fault of the Company, (3) become available to the Company on a non-confidential basis, or (4) are independently developed by the Company or its Affiliates without reference to the furnished information.
perturbation.explanation: A one-year confidentiality period may be deemed insufficient under Japanese law for protecting certain types of sensitive business information or trade secrets, potentially conflicting with regulations on unfair competition and trade secret protection.
perturbation.contradicted_law: The Unfair Competition Prevention Act (不正競争防止法) in Japan protects trade secrets, and limiting the confidentiality period to one year may be insufficient to provide adequate protection.

perturbation.original_text: Settlement Date shall mean the 5t h Japan Business Day following the last day of the Offer Period, except as such date may be adjusted pursuant to Section 2.02(f).
perturbation.changed_text: Settlement Date shall mean the 10t h Japan Business Day following the last day of the Offer Period, except as such date may be adjusted pursuant to Section 2.02(f).
perturbation.explanation: Delaying the settlement date could potentially violate regulations in Japan about the timeliness of settlement procedures following a tender offer.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Financial Instruments and Exchange Act (FIEL) of Japan regulates the procedure and deadlines for settlement of tender offers.
